name: 尹秦清　教師諮商時間(Office Hours)
objective: This course introduces the evolution of e-commerce and its current status. The content will cover important topics of e-commerce development, including e-commerce business models, mobile commerce, application of artificial intelligence and big data techniques to e-commerce. Furthermore, some important theories in consumer behavior, organizational behavior, and information systems will be discussed. During the semester, the students will be able to understand the concepts and current situation of e-commerce, the impact of information technology that drives the development of e-commerce, the opportunities and challenges that modern companies face, and how to apply theories to improve customer experience in the e-commerce context, etc.
schedule:
Week 1: What is E-commerce? I
Week 2: What is E-commerce? II
Week 3: Business Model of E-commerce
Week 4: Infrastructure of Electronic Commerce 
Week 5: Application of E-commerce I
Week 6: Application of E-commerce II
Week 7: Internet and Mobile Platform 
Week 8: Holiday for Taipei Tech’s Anniversary
Week 9: Midterm exam
Week 10: Internet Consumer Behavior
Week 11: Online Retail and Services
Week 12: E-business
Week 13: Mobile Commerce 
Week 14: Social Commerce 
Week 15: Construction of E-commerce Website
Week 16: E-Commerce Ethics and Related Regulations
Week 17: Prospection and Future of E-commerce
Week 18: Final Report (PPT presentation)
scorePolicy:
1. Attendance & Class Participation: 20% 
2. Case Study Presentation: 20%
3. Midterm Exam: 30%
4. Final Report: 30%
materials:
1. Laudon, K. C. & Traver, C. G. E-Commerce 2021-2022: Business, Technology, Society, 17th Edition (2021). Pearson press.
2. Turban, E., King, D., Lee, J.K., Liang, T. P., & Turban, D.C. (2012). Electronic Commerce: A Managerial and Social Networks Perspective. 8th Edition. Pearson/Prentice Hall.
